Was seriously lacking and well below par for a place of this sort. Yes, it was very busy. Since when did that become and excuse for poor service IN a service based industry?? Our waitress was inattentive, slow, and we clearly had just half of her already fractured attention. Also.......a personality to be rivaled only by moldy driftwood. I get that it was Queen's Feast and there are alot of "po folk" out living the good life for half the price so tips are going to be lacking. However, I tip extremely generously when you have earned it, regardless. Do your job, do it well or go home.   All in all, would eat there again for a special occasion. Some of the dishes are a bit over priced, the food was good, the place itself had a nice vibe, but service left alot to be desired.

Terrific atmosphere and excellent service.  The appetizers are very small, so be forewarned, but the quality was very good.  I enjoyed my dinner (Moroccan Lamb), but my wife's Veal Osso Bucco was too salty and had to be exchanged for the Mushroom Bolognese.  The waiter took care of this very quickly and I was impressed overall.  Good experience!

Very long review, so if you only read the first sentence, just order the Duo of Wild Boar; it is amazing.  The first surprise we noticed about the restaurant is that they offer a free valet.  In other cities, we've payed up to $25 for this convenience.  They do a great job, so make sure to tip big.  The restaurant itself is on the ground floor, so you'll mainly come here for the Jazz instead of the view.  It is well decorated and inviting.  However, If your a tall person, like myself (I'm 6'3"), you may find the tables and chairs slightly uncomfortable.  For appetizers, we had the scallops and the calamari.  The waiter claimed that the scallops made the restaurant famous.  The scallops were more of an amuse-bouch, with only two served per order.  They were fresh and well-cooked, however, there was nothing special to set them as outstanding; just salt for flavoring.  We don't recall the fava bean puree or marmalade that was supposed to be apart of the dish.  The calamari was very dry.  Not a bad dish, just mediocre.  Wine: Blue has a very extensive wine list, so it takes some time for a selection.  The first bottle of wine was a little too sweet, but served professionally.  The second bottle, one that the waiter recommended, ordered was sold-out.  The third bottle was horribly corked, for which the waiter and manager both apologized profusely.  However, by the time our "second" bottle of wine was served, desserts were being ordered.  For Mid Courses, a few of us ordered the Butternut Squash and Jumbo Lump Crab Soup.  It was watered down and very under-seasoned.  All of us had to add salt and ask the server for crushed black pepper.  Most of us felt that they had tried to stretch the dish out by adding water.  Very underwhelming dish.  For Entrees, most of the party ordered the Duo of Wild Boar.  This dish was highly recommended by the waiter and one of the members of the party.  Everyone loved the dish.  It was complex, well-seasoned, and paired perfectly with the amazing chard and risotto.  The party member that recommended the boar wanted to try a different dish and ordered the Beef Tenderloin.  He enjoyed the cut of meat, but said he preferred the boar.  Additional dishes that were ordered were the Braised Lamb Shank and the Grilled Bison.  If you are not in the mood for the boar, I'd suggest the lamb solely on its appearance.  We didn't get to try the dish, but it looked amazing and was enjoyed by the party member that ordered it.  The Bison looked good, but it was on the al a carte menu.  That menu doesn't have signature or paired sides.  We typically don't order desserts, but we shared the Colombian Dark Chocolate Mousse.  It was a decent mousse, but the appearance of the Sticky Toffee Pudding, which everyone else ordered, really out-shined our dish.  We didn't get to try the pudding, but it looked and smelled amazing and we'd recommend it over the mousse.  Overall, Blue has a great wait staff, upscale dining atmosphere, and live Jazz music (Unfortunately, we are not huge fans of jazz, so we didn't take the music into consideration for our review).  Some of our dishes were very mediocre, but the Wild Boar is such a great dish that it pushed our rating up to a 3.5.

We were very excited to find out that Blue was open the Friday of a snowstorm, since we had made reservations with our friends for restaurant week.  Luckily the restaurant was not packed because of the storm which is always a plus during restaurant week. Our waiter came by to take our order for drinks and we all hopped on the fancy martini train. As we waited, a fresh batch of bread and butter came out. I would come back to this place for the bread and butter by itself.   Here's where it got a little strange. Our waiter came back and accidentally poured the wrong alcohol in the wrong glass ( understandable, mistakes happen). So a cucumber martini into a cinnamon rimmed glass. He noticed his mistake right away, but instead of taking it back to the bar he said, "maybe it'll taste good" or something to that extent. Anyway, the drink was good after I wiped away the cinnamon rim.  The risotto balls were a little bland, but had a very crispy texture. The pork osso bucco was meh, as was the ravioli.  However, the sticky toffee pudding was to die for. We will not seek this place out but wouldn't mind coming back for dessert, bread and butter!

I like this place. All of my experiences here have been warm and fuzzy. Service is good. Ambiance is nice. Jazz on Thursdays - Sat I believe?   Their filets are decent. If I remember correctly, they were char grilled and not broiled. Their oso buco is to die for. Rich, tender and cooked to perfection.  No complaints and I would definately return. At least until a bad experience. =)
it was ok.    mussels were good.  service ok.  ambiance seemed dated.  worth a trip, but not sure i would go back.

Nice upscale bar & restaurant for live jazz music and food. Located within walking distance to the Epicentre. The ambience is intimate with dim lighting but love enough for groups & girls night out or a nice happy hour. There's valet parking for your convenience. Explore Blue Restaurant & Bar scene if your looking for a great music venue while enjoying dinner.  ~Christy

Came for the first time during restaurant week. Impressively, it stayed open during the ice storm when many other restaurants shut down.  I ordered the Arrancini (first course), Jumbo Scallops and Short Rib (entree), and the Sticky Toffee Pudding (dessert). The Arrancini and dessert were both good but the scallops and short rib really stood out the most. The portions were quite generous, especially by restaurant week standards.   Our server was fast, attentive, and friendly, but he struggled with the cocktails a bit. He mixed up our garnishes and forgot to put the bleu cheese-stuffed olives in my friend's martini. This may not sound like a big deal, but when you're paying $10+ per drink, you don't want to have a cinnamon rim instead of a cucumber.  Despite the cocktail issue, we had a very pleasant experience overall. If you're looking for a good meal uptown for restaurant week, definitely give Blue a try.

Four stars only because I went on a slow night and they weren't as quick to serve as I would have liked - probably due to low waitstaff BUT. The staff was nice, knowledgeable, and fun! The food was spectacular and the new bar (smaller portioned) sizes are perfect for amazing food that won't have you so stuffed you don't hit the epicenter after dinner!  I will be back soooooo soon! Definitely one of my new favs of the city

Took quite awhile between my review of the bar and live music part of Blue and the restaurant side but, here I am and boy am I glad.  Went for dinner with my wife and a couple friends from work ahead of a Charlotte Squawks show and every bit of the meal was fabulous.  In terms of service, I have to say that I believe this was as professional as I've ever experienced in Charlotte.  From tableside manner to knowledge of the menu, past and present to attentiveness.  Just spot on.  Thank you Scott.  Suffice it to say that everyone was very pleased with what they ordered but I'll stick with what I ate.  Started with the seared Hudson Valley foie gras and it was the perfect, fatty, savory bit of heaven with which to start the meal.  For my entree, I got the whole Branzino which was served with some risotto.  The fish was perfectly moist, simply seasoned and filleted tableside by the aforementioned awesome server.  My only regret is that I was not able to order my first runner up on the menu, the duo of wild boar and I can only hope that it's still on the menu when we visit next.

mehh my boyfriend wanted to surprise me with a new restaurant for Valentine's day. I'm just going to break this down into pros vs cons.  Pros:  1. They offer FLIGHTS OF WINE. Be still my indecisive heart. Three half pours of wine for like $15.  2. While it is not a large menu, the variety of offerings was really interesting.  3. Arrancini. If I ever go back to this restaurant I want approx. 6 orders of this.  4. Sweet table bread with kalamata olive butter. Weird, tasty. 5. Truffle Mashed Potatoes. 6. My boyfriend said his NY strip was tasty, just not a top choice for him in cuts of meat and there wasn't much beef selection.   7. Wild boar tenderloin. Kind of.  Cons: 1. (This might be a pro to some) Boyfriend ordered their house cocktail. I don't know what it was but it was windex blue and tasted like straight vodka. He couldn't drink it. I couldn't even sniff it.  2. Waitress "forgot" to mention the sweetheart special and when we asked about it she was like "oh you mean our early bird menu. You want to see that?" It could have been a genuine mistake, her reaction was just a little off-putting. She was super sweet otherwise.  3.As stated before, the menu had a lot of variety, which is nice if everything tastes good, but if you can't do it all, don't.  4. I'm not going to pretend that I am super familiar with balls of shredded meat, but this one just wasn't doing it for me. Creme brulee was alright taste-wise, but certainly not anything amazing. I sincerely hope it was a mistake and that was the portion size meant for the 3 course sweetheart special.   All in all, I promise you can find a better restaurant in Charlotte.
